raw_text:
Edu blasts Arsenal
 
 Arsenal's Brazilian midfielder Edu has hit out at the club for stalling over offering him a new contract.
 
 Edu's deal expires next summer and he has been linked with Spanish trio Real Madrid, Barcelona and Valencia. He told BBC Sport: "I'm not sure if I want to stay or not because the club have let the situation go on this far. "If they had really wanted to sign they should have come up with an offer six months before indicating they wanted to sign me and that's made me think." Edu's brother and representative Amadeo Fensao has previously said that Arsenal's current offer to the midfielder was well short of what he was seeking. And Edu, 26, added: "My brother is due to come to London on Thursday.
 
 "There is a meeting planned for 6 or 7 January to sort it out with Arsenal. "Now I have a choice to stay or go. I want to sort it out as soon as possible, that's in the best interests of both the club and myself. "I'm going to make my decision after the meeting later this week." Edu is now able to begin negotiations with other clubs because Fifa regulations allow players to start talks six months before their contracts expire. The midfielder, who broke in to the Brazilian national side in 2004, admitted he had been flattered to have been linked with the three Spanish giants. Edu said: "I've just heard stories from the news that the Madrid president Florentino Perez, the Valencia people, as well as Barcelona are interested.
 
 "That's nice, but I've never talked to them, so I can't say they want me sign 100%." Last month Wenger said he we was hopeful Edu would sign a new deal and played down suggestions that the lure of a club like Real Madrid would be too strong for Edu. Edu added that he had been encouraged by Wenger's support for him. "I still have a good relationship with Arsene Wenger - he's always said he wants me to sign."
llama3.2:1b: Edu, an Arsenal midfielder, has expressed frustration over the club's slow progress in offering him a new contract despite being linked to other clubs.
His deal expires next summer, and Edu has stated that his decision will be made after a meeting with Arsenal.
Eduardo Fensao, his brother and representative, had previously said that Arsenal's offer was insufficient.
The midfielder is now able to start negotiations due to Fifa regulations allowing players to initiate talks six months before contract expiration.
llama3.2:3b: Arsenal midfielder Edu has criticized the club for not offering him a new contract sooner, saying it has made him question his decision to stay or leave.
He will meet with Arsenal on January 6-7 to discuss his future and is now able to negotiate with other clubs due to Fifa regulations.
gemma2:2b: Edu, an Arsenal midfielder whose contract is expiring, has expressed dissatisfaction with the club's lack of action on extending it.
He believes that Arsenal failed to initiate negotiations and now faces making a decision regarding his future, potentially leaving for other clubs.
He has received interest from Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia.
While he acknowledges this excitement, he hasn't confirmed their intentions or made any concrete decisions.

He believes that Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia are also interested in signing him due to different reasons, such as the possibility of being linked with them.
Edu mentioned that he is uncertain if he wants to stay at Arsenal because they have allowed the situation to drag on too long.
If they had made an offer six months before indicating they wanted to sign him, it would have been helpful for him.
He has also spoken to his brother about a meeting with Arsenal on 6 or 7 January and is now ready to make a decision.
After attending the meeting, he will discuss the matter later this week.

Edu hopes to secure a new deal by meeting with Arsenal officials on January 6-7.

His deal expires next summer and he is reportedly linked with Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia in Spain.
Edu stated that if Arsenal had made a serious offer six months ago, it would have changed his mind about staying at the club.

He plans to meet with Arsenal officials on January 6th or 7th to discuss future options, including potentially signing elsewhere due to FIFA regulations allowing negotiations six months before contract expiration.
While Edu has been flattered by interest from Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia, he admits not having direct contact with these clubs yet.
Wenger expressed hope that Edu would sign a new deal, but Edu maintained his positive relationship with the manager and is still open to staying at Arsenal.

He told BBC Sport: "I'm not sure if I want to stay or not because the club have let the situation go on this far."
If they had really wanted to sign them up for six months before indicating they wanted to sign him, that's what he made of it.

That's nice, but I’ve never talked to them about his signing.
Last month Wenger we were hopeful that Edu would sign a new deal and played down suggestions that the lure of a club like Real Madrid would be too strong for him.

He added that the club has been linked with Spanish giants Real Madrid, Barcelona and Valencia, but did not say which clubs they are interested in signing with.
Edu said he was not sure if he wants to stay or go because the club have let the situation go on this far.
"I'm not sure if I want to stay or go because the club have let the situation go on this far," Edu said.
"If they had really wanted to sign me and that's made me think."
Edu added that his brother and representative Amadeo Fensao has previously said that Arsenal's current offer to the midfielder was well short of what he is seeking.
And Edu, 26, added: "My brother is due to come to London on Thursday.
Now I have a choice to stay or go.
I want to sort it out with Arsenal as soon as possible because there is a meeting planned for 6 or 7 January to sort it out with other clubs."

deepseek-r1:1.5b: Arsene Wenger's Brazilian midfielder, Edu, is currently linked with Spanish giants Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia.
He has been quoted as being unsure of whether to stay due to Arsenal's slow negotiations for a new contract, which expires next summer.
His brother Amadeo previously suggested that Arsenal might have offered a better deal than he sought.
Edu, 26, has now resumed negotiating with other clubs since FIFA regulations allow players to start talks six months prior to contract expiration.
He admitted to being flattered by the news of his linkages but remains uncertain about the club's interest in him.
Wenger expressed hope for a new deal and gave credence to his relationship with Arsene Wenger, who has always sought Edu's signing.
tinyllama:1.1b: Edu Blasts Arsenal, Releasing Statement Over Stalking by Club's Representative
tinydolphin:1.1b: The current situation involving Edu, a Brazilian midfielder who is currently at the club Arsenal, has sparked rumors of his potential departure.

However, Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has expressed concerns about whether they can offer Edu the salary he is seeking, which may have played a role in the midfielder's decision to discuss new terms with other clubs.

Brazilian media reports have indicated that Edu had a meeting with the club earlier this month where it was suggested that Arsenal were willing to pay him up to £30 million per year, which would make him the second-highest earner in the team's history behind manager Arsene Wenger himself.
However, sources close to Edu have disputed these reports, stating that his current contract is set to expire next summer and he has never discussed a new deal with the club.
Despite these rumors, it appears that Edu may indeed be considering other options.
Last month, Arsenal captain Mikel Arteta expressed his hope that Edu would sign a new deal, stating, "I think he should stay.
He's made an impact at the club and I'm sure that if they want him to stay, they will offer him a nice sum of money."
However, Edu himself has not spoken out publicly about any potential negotiations with other clubs, which may indicate that he is considering his options before making a decision.

In conclusion, the situation surrounding Edu's future at Arsenal remains uncertain, as it appears that rumors and speculation about his future have led to differing opinions within the team and among the Brazilian public.
phi:2.7b: Arsenal's Brazilian midfielder Edu is considering leaving the club over their failure to offer him a new contract.
He has been linked with Spanish teams Real Madrid, Barcelona and Valencia.
His brother and representative Amadeo Fensao have previously criticized Arsenal's current offer.
Edu plans to make his decision after a meeting later this week when he can start negotiations with other clubs due to Fifa regulations.

He is currently able to begin negotiations with other clubs because Fifa regulations allow players to start talks six months before their contracts expire.
hermes3:3b: Edu criticizes Arsenal over contract delay, hints at leaving.

He has been linked with Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia but is uncertain about staying due to Arsenal's slow negotiations.
Edu's brother and representative, Amadeo Fensao, has stated that Arsenal's offer falls short of expectations.
A meeting is scheduled for early January to resolve the situation, and Edu plans to decide afterward.
Under FIFA rules, he is now free to negotiate with other clubs.
While flattered by interest from Spanish giants, he has had no direct talks with them.
Despite the uncertainty, Edu maintains a good relationship with manager Arsène Wenger, who has expressed hope that he will stay.
stablelm2:1.6b: Brazilian midfielder Edu has criticized Arsenal for delaying his contract renewal and allowing the situation to escalate, while also being linked with Spanish clubs Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia.

Despite breaking into Brazil's national team in 2014, Edu expressed uncertainty over his future at the club due to Arsenal's lack of interest in offering a new contract before its expiration next summer.

Fifa regulations allow players to start negotiations six months before their contracts expire, which Edu is now able to use as he plans to make his decision after a meeting with his brother and representative scheduled for Thursday.

Wenger said that he remains hopeful about Edu signing a new deal, while the Arsenal manager played down suggestions that the lure of a club like Real Madrid would overpower Edu's interest in remaining at the Gunners' academy.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Arsenal midfielder Edu has expressed disappointment over the club's delayed offer of a new contract, which expires next summer.
Edu, 26, has been linked with Real Madrid, Barcelona, and Valencia.
He stated that Arsenal should have made an official proposal six months ago to sign him, making his decision unclear.
His brother and representative, Amadeo Fensao, claims the current offer falls short of Edu's expectations.
Edu plans to meet with Arsenal on January 6 or 7 to finalize his future, as FIFA regulations permit such negotiations six months before contract expiration.
Despite interest from top Spanish clubs, Edu maintains a positive relationship with manager Arsene Wenger, who has publicly supported his extension at the club.
